creator: mangst@inventec.ch
text:
The attached patch is a refactoring of the Canoo webtests. It adds macros for
login (is now import-example-content-aware) and logout and an entity for
configuration that relies on build.properties. This makes it possible to change
host and port, for example if you want to debug with WebScarab.

There is also a shiny new test for editing user group affiliations. One or two
bugs in existing tests have been fixed as well.

Created attachment 20668
Patch as described below
creator: mangst@inventec.ch
mangst@inventec.ch
text:
Maybe it could be useful to apply this before the freeze to have it available
for testing. WDYT?

good idea. however, i don't feel qualified to commit it, since i (oh the shame)
haven't yet worked with canoo. andreas?
creator: nettings@apache.org
andreas@apache.org
text:
Unfortunately I can't apply the patch, even after stripping the
C:/lenya/lenya-2.0-dev path segments. Maybe there is an issue with line endings?
Is somebody else able to apply it?

(In reply to comment #4)
> Unfortunately I can't apply the patch, even after stripping the
> C:/lenya/lenya-2.0-dev path segments. Maybe there is an issue with line endings?
> Is somebody else able to apply it?

no, sorry. i've had problems with markus' patches recently, too, but couldn't
find the cause. line endings seem to be \n only (unless my browser does
automatic conversion). don't know what's wrong. maybe it's god's way of telling
us markus needs commit rights? ;)
creator: nettings@apache.org

text:
Commited in r588647. Had to throw a -l in to have patch ignore whitespace. Close
if this has fixed it. Thanks for the patch.
creator: rfrovarp@apache.org
mangst@inventec.ch
text:
> i've had problems with markus' patches recently, too, but couldn't
> find the cause. line endings seem to be \n only (unless my browser does
> automatic conversion). don't know what's wrong.

I unticked an "ignore whitespace" checkbox in my eclipse compare/patch settings.
Maybe this will help in the future.

> maybe it's god's way of telling us markus needs commit rights? ;)

I don't think that god wanted to say anything like this. (S)he rather wanted to
say: Look, Markus is not even able to create a patch properly... ;-)

> Commited in r588647. Had to throw a -l in to have patch ignore whitespace. 
> Close if this has fixed it. Thanks for the patch.

Thanks, Richard. I can't test it yet, because there are three files missing:

src/modules/development/test/canoo/doconfig.xml
src/modules/development/test/canoo/lenya_webtest.dtd
src/modules/development/test/canoo/macros.xml

They appear in the patch but somehow didn't get created.
creator: mangst@inventec.ch

text:
that's the bad thing about patches - they don't "svn add" automatically. there
really should be an "svn patch" command that does that. or maybe there is?
creator: nettings@apache.org
rfrovarp@apache.org
text: Yeah, that's what happened. They are in there now, r588753. Sorry.

creator: mangst@inventec.ch
text:
(In reply to comment #10)
> Yeah, that's what happened. They are in there now, r588753. Sorry.

Thanks, unfortunately the content of the three added files is doubled now... :-)

(In reply to comment #11)

> Thanks, unfortunately the content of the three added files is doubled now... :-)

Hi Markus - I removed the doubled part of the content in the 3 files.

text: The web tests work for me. Can we close this issue?
